channel.title: Formula 1 Season 2012
channel.description:
[align=center][img]https://img18.imageshack.us/img18/7483/40070266.png[/img][/align]
With Sky sports getting a lot of cash and BBC getting not that much, and [url='https://4.bp.blogspot.com/_h0GaLYr_B88/TIoTeby-_3I/AAAAAAAAINs/BvJwOSfnFCE/s1600/1.jpg']this motherfucker[/url] owning everyone in Melbourne, we're back to F1 in the year 2012.
Malaysia GP in 10 hours time, with the best 2 front rows ever in the history of F1 (bar loolooham on pole, can't help but hate this twat nowadays): [img]https://img831.imageshack.us/img831/7033/79279568.png[/img]
Motherfucka Michael qualifying 3rd! Webber and Raikkonen posting exact same times! Unbelievable scenes.
Bets? I sure hope Hamilton winds up behind both Jenson and Schumacher.

item.title: Formula 1 Season 2012
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Yeah, it’s WRC, but damn those were times of glory. Group B will be missed

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GRvUUQnfYNI
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pfsRtRlxOws&feature=related

item.title: Formula 1 Season 2012
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Watched BBC “extended highlights” dragged from iplayer - it’s pretty much the full race, plus pre- and post- shows are intact. Coverage is upper-class compared to what sky does currently.

Only downside is that it isn’t live. Oh well, China will be live.

Read full topic

item.title: Formula 1 Season 2012
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
He tends to go where the premier coverage for the sport is(He was with ITV when it was on their channel). Which makes sense, but with the plit coverage this year, bbc always giving the best coverage, it is disappointing

Read full topic

item.title: Formula 1 Season 2012
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Siggs:

Bitches watching it on sky spoiling it for us BBC watchers. It’s an absolutely fucking retarded deal going on for the coverage

Beeb coverage and pre-/post- shows are also heaps better than sky sport so far. And that ridiculous 600 quid a year rate.
Never understood why Martin Brundle left as well…

item.title: Formula 1 Season 2012
item.dc:creator: Mont_Blanc
item.description:
Pretty epic race in Sepang today, with Alonso managing to win and awesome Perez who could beat the shit out of him.
But IMO Mclarens is the team to watch this year, Red Bull is kinda average without its blown diffuser.

Malaysia GP in 10 hours time, with the best 2 front rows ever in the history of F1 (bar loolooham on pole, can’t help but hate this twat nowadays):

Bets? I sure hope Hamilton winds up behind both Jenson and Schumacher.
